alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 07 at 10:32AM EDT until September 08 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. .The runoff from the heavy rain over the Labor Day weekend is working its way downstream. Blantyre has crested and will fall late today and tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. The river is forecast to drop below flood stage Thursday morning. The river will fall below action stage of 15 feet by Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues. Floodwaters continue to inundate farmland between the French Broad River and the old railroad bed. Floodwaters may start to inundate the shoulders of River Road near the Big Willow Road intersection. Floodwaters continue to impact boat access areas at Grove Bridge Rd. and Crab Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:01 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:01 AM EDT Wednesday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 8.5 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 10/17/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued late tonight before 1230 AM EDT.
